"ee776f35-649b-4725-bcc6-ea1598e9ce6c", "message": {"id": "ee776f35-649b-4725-bcc6-ea1598e9ce6c", "author": {"role": "tool", "name": "chat_consensus_app__jit_plugin.search_papers", "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1709661976.723549, "update_time": 1709661934.612156, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["{&quot;items&quot;:[{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Prompting AI Art: An Investigation into the Creative Skill of Prompt Engineering&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;We are witnessing a novel era of creativity where anyone can create digital content via prompt-based learning (known as prompt engineering). This paper delves into prompt engineering as a novel creative skill for creating AI art with text-to-image generation. In a pilot study, we find that many crowdsourced participants have knowledge about art which could be used for writing effective prompts. In three subsequent studies, we explore whether crowdsourced participants can put this knowledge into practice. We examine if participants can 1) discern prompt quality, 2) write prompts, and 3) refine prompts. We find that participants could evaluate prompt quality and crafted descriptive prompts, but they lacked style-specific vocabulary necessary for effective prompting. This is in line with our hypothesis that prompt engineering is a new type of skill that is non-intuitive and must first be acquired (e.g., through means of practice and learning) before it can be used. Our studies deepen our understanding of prompt engineering and chart future research directions. We offer nine guidelines for conducting research on text-to-image generation and prompt engineering with paid crowds. We conclude by envisioning four potential futures for prompt engineering.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;J. Oppenlaender&quot;,&quot;Rhema Linder&quot;,&quot;Johanna M. Silvennoinen&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;ArXiv&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompting-investigation-creative-skill-prompt-oppenlaender/1c43c1fb2f5c534188fbc227a0c5de4d/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.48550/arXiv.2303.13534&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;abs/2303.13534&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:1},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Optimizing Mobile-Edge AI-Generated Everything (AIGX) Services by Prompt Engineering: Fundamental, Framework, and Case Study&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;As the next-generation paradigm for content creation, AI-Generated Content (AIGC), i.e., generating content automatically by Generative AI (GAI) based on user prompts, has gained great attention and success recently. With the ever-increasing power of GAI, especially the emergence of Pretrained Foundation Models (PFMs) that contain billions of parameters and prompt engineering methods (i.e., finding the best prompts for the given task), the application range of AIGC is rapidly expanding, covering various forms of information for human, systems, and networks, such as network designs, channel coding, and optimization solutions. In this article, we present the concept of mobile-edge AI-Generated Everything (AIGX). Specifically, we first review the building blocks of AIGX, the evolution from AIGC to AIGX, as well as practical AIGX applications. Then, we present a unified mobile-edge AIGX framework, which employs edge devices to provide PFM-empowered AIGX services and optimizes such services via prompt engineering. More importantly, we demonstrate that suboptimal prompts lead to poor generation quality, which adversely affects user satisfaction, edge network performance, and resource utilization. Accordingly, we conduct a case study, showcasing how to train an effective prompt optimizer using ChatGPT and investigating how much improvement is possible with prompt engineering in terms of user experience, quality of generation, and network performance.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Yinqiu Liu&quot;,&quot;Hongyang Du&quot;,&quot;D. Niyato&quot;,&quot;Jiawen Kang&quot;,&quot;Shuguang Cui&quot;,&quot;Xuemin Shen&quot;,&quot;Ping Zhang&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;ArXiv&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/optimizing-mobileedge-aigenerated-everything-aigx-liu/e6a117d445da5c91b753a7fb1e4f5759/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.48550/arXiv.2309.01065&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;abs/2309.01065&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:2},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Prompt Engineering in Medical Education&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;Artificial intelligence-powered generative language models (GLMs), such as ChatGPT, Perplexity AI, and Google Bard, have the potential to provide personalized learning, unlimited practice opportunities, and interactive engagement 24/7, with immediate feedback. However, to fully utilize GLMs, properly formulated instructions are essential. Prompt engineering is a systematic approach to effectively communicating with GLMs to achieve the desired results. Well-crafted prompts yield good responses from the GLM, while poorly constructed prompts will lead to unsatisfactory responses. Besides the challenges of prompt engineering, significant concerns are associated with using GLMs in medical education, including ensuring accuracy, mitigating bias, maintaining privacy, and avoiding excessive reliance on technology. Future directions involve developing more sophisticated prompt engineering techniques, integrating GLMs with other technologies, creating personalized learning pathways, and researching the effectiveness of GLMs in medical education.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Thomas F. Heston&quot;,&quot;Charya Khun&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;International Medical Education&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompt-engineering-medical-education-heston/118cb874d1405cdab9cfa1b29cea0108/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.3390/ime2030019&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:3},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Model-Driven Prompt Engineering&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;Generative artificial intelligence (AI) systems are capable of synthesizing complex content such as text, source code or images according to the instructions described in a natural language prompt. The quality of the output depends on crafting a suitable prompt. This has given rise to prompt engineering, the process of designing natural language prompts to best take advantage of the capabilities of generative AI systems.Through experimentation, the creative and research communities have created guidelines and strategies for creating good prompts. However, even for the same task, these best practices vary depending on the particular system receiving the prompt. Moreover, some systems offer additional features using a custom platform-specific syntax, e.g., assigning a degree of relevance to specific concepts within the prompt.In this paper, we propose applying model-driven engineering to support the prompt engineering process. Using a domain-specific language (DSL), we define platform-independent prompts that can later be adapted to provide good quality outputs in a target AI system. The DSL also facilitates managing prompts by providing mechanisms for prompt versioning and prompt chaining. Tool support is available thanks to a Langium-based Visual Studio Code plugin.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;R. Claris\u00f3&quot;,&quot;Jordi Cabot&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;2023 ACM/IEEE 26th International Conference on Model Driven Engineering Languages and Systems (MODELS)&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/modeldriven-prompt-engineering-claris\u00f3/9f1c1cb58a1854678e3cd3b2f80a7999/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.1109/MODELS58315.2023.00020&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;47-54&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:4},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Technology Enabled Content In Engineering Science Curriculum&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;Engineering technology technical courses often have both lecture and accompanying laboratory sessions. The laboratory assignments reinforce the understanding of the topics studied during the lecture sessions. A planning grant was awarded from the National Science Foundation through their Bridges for Engineering Education Program to develop technology-enabled content in engineering science courses. Content was developed to appeal to a variety of learning styles and to support student-centered learning. This paper will describe the content development and delivery and discuss the impact it had on engineering technology education. Course / Content Development Content was developed to support a course in Flexible Automation offered in the College of Applied Science. The content was developed collaboratively among educational technology experts in the College of Engineering, faculty from the College of Applied Science, and experts in instructional design in the College of Education. The project sought to develop content that would appeal to a variety of student learning styles and thus better engage the students in the learning process 1 . The various modes of instruction developed during the project were categorized as: \u2022 Read It \u2013 text and illustrations to appeal to visual learners / linguistic learners \u2022 Watch It \u2013 streaming media presentation to appeal to visual learners / auditory learners \u2022 Visualize It \u2013 animations to appeal to spatial learners / visual learners \u2022 Try It \u2013 active exercises to appeal to kinesthetic learners / active learners Guidelines based on models of best practice 2,3 were established for content creation to ensure instructional design appropriate for technology-mediated education was used. These guidelines were developed by the collaborators from the College of Education and the participating faculty. Each of the instructional modalities listed above had an associated content development guideline. These guidelines are shown in Figures 1 4. With these guidelines in place, material was developed by graduate assistants working with faculty, instructional designers, and the project manager. The new materials were developed to be a supplement and / or extension of the \u201ctraditional\u201d materials and to be delivered via the web or CD-Rom. Animations and active exercises were derived from materials presented in the textbooks to be consistent with that resource. Streaming media presentations and web-based text and graphics were derived from both the course text and other standard texts to provide a richer educational resource. P ge 10249.1 Proceedings of the 2005 American Society for Engineering Education Annual Conference &amp; Exposition Copyright \u00a9 2005, American Society for Engineering Education Figure 1 \u201cTry It\u201d Content Development Guidelines Technology-Enabled Engineering Science Content \u201cTry It\u201d Content Development Guidelines This module allows students to interact with the content to the greatest degree possible. It is intended to support active learning and student inquiry. Module contains: 1. Description of the content of the section and a procedure for using the module 2. Physical model and a graphic representation 3. Interactive exercise that allows students to manipulate variables and see the outcomes of this manipulation 4. Discussion of what happens for each interaction 5. Discussion of the underlying principles Description A brief summary of the topic covered (e.g. stress), a cross reference to the section in the textbook, and an explanation of how the module works. This explanation should provide clear instructions on how parameters are manipulated and how the student receives feedback. The explanation should also inform students of any options they have and how to get help if they need it. Models To provide a real world context, the module should first introduce a familiar concept or situation for which the topic is applicable (e.g., a bridge). A graphical representation such as a free body diagram should then be shown. Interactive Exercise Students are able to change various aspects of the model and see the results of these manipulations. Clarity is very important \u2013 there must be an understandable connection between cause and effect. What Happened An explanation of the cause and effect should be given (e.g., increasing the load on the bridge caused the stress to increase). Underlying Principles The cause and effect discussed above should be related to the underlying principles being presented. This will typically be an explanation of the governing equations and which variables in the equations were involved in the manipulations.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;E. Rutz&quot;,&quot;V. Elkins&quot;,&quot;J. Pittman&quot;,&quot;Max Rabiee&quot;,&quot;Richard K. Miller&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2005,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/technology-enabled-content-engineering-science-rutz/c5034ff4039f5fb992c03544c287f223/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.18260/1-2--15172&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:5},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Building an Effective Advisory Board for Grant Submissions&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;This Special Session will engage engineering and computing education professionals in an interactive discussion of how to find and use the expertise of an advisory board when writing and executing funded projects. Our recent research of effective practices for supporting early career faculty in engineering education has shown that grant administration is an area that many faculty feel unprepared to manage. Beyond writing an excellent grant proposal, the skills required to carry out the planned grant activities are different from those addressed in existing professional development opportunities and are essential the success of a grant. This session will provide an interactive discussion and development of tools on one specific aspect of grant proposal writing and management\u2014advisory boards. Advisory boards are an essential part of leveraging the expertise in the wider engineering education community, but there are various ways of strategically building and engaging advisory boards in grant work. The outcomes of this session will be a set of tools for faculty to use in building and leveraging the expertise of an advisory board in grant submissions.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Allison Godwin&quot;,&quot;J. Karlin&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2019,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;2019 IEEE Frontiers in Education Conference (FIE)&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/building-effective-advisory-board-grant-submissions-godwin/0cad4a855c235145b3bce730355b7d88/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.1109/FIE43999.2019.9028430&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;1-3&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:6},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Prompt Engineering as an Important Emerging Skill for Medical Professionals: Tutorial&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;Prompt engineering is a relatively new field of research that refers to the practice of designing, refining, and implementing prompts or instructions that guide the output of large language models (LLMs) to help in various tasks. With the emergence of LLMs, the most popular one being ChatGPT that has attracted the attention of over a 100 million users in only 2 months, artificial intelligence (AI), especially generative AI, has become accessible for the masses. This is an unprecedented paradigm shift not only because of the use of AI becoming more widespread but also due to the possible implications of LLMs in health care. As more patients and medical professionals use AI-based tools, LLMs being the most popular representatives of that group, it seems inevitable to address the challenge to improve this skill. This paper summarizes the current state of research about prompt engineering and, at the same time, aims at providing practical recommendations for the wide range of health care professionals to improve their interactions with LLMs.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;B. Mesk\u00f3&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;Journal of Medical Internet Research&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompt-engineering-important-emerging-skill-medical-mesk\u00f3/4018766b33a65b4a84d44f1b03d245af/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.2196/50638&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;25&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:7},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Prompt Engineering For Students of Medicine and Their Teachers&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;\\&quot;Prompt Engineering for Students of Medicine and Their Teachers\\&quot;brings the principles of prompt engineering for large language models such as ChatGPT and Google Bard to medical education. This book contains a comprehensive guide to prompt engineering to help both teachers and students improve education in the medical field. Just as prompt engineering is critical in getting good information out of an AI, it is also critical to get students to think and understand more deeply. The principles of prompt engineering that we have learned from AI systems have the potential to simultaneously revolutionize learning in the healthcare field. The book analyzes from multiple angles the anatomy of a good prompt for both AI models and students. The different types of prompts are examined, showing how each style has unique characteristics and applications. The principles of prompt engineering, applied properly, are demonstrated to be effective in teaching across the diverse fields of anatomy, physiology, pathology, pharmacology, and clinical skills. Just like ChatGPT and similar large language AI models, students need clear and detailed prompting in order for them to fully understand a topic. Using identical principles, a prompt that gets good information from an AI will also cause a student to think more deeply and accurately. The process of prompt engineering facilitates this process. Because each chapter contains multiple examples and key takeaways, it is a practical guide for implementing prompt engineering in the learning process. It provides a hands-on approach to ensure readers can immediately apply the concepts they learn&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Thomas F. Heston&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;ArXiv&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompt-engineering-students-medicine-their-teachers-heston/1962f9531f385093a668c3757e4066d7/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.48550/arXiv.2308.11628&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;abs/2308.11628&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:8},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Prompted Software Engineering in the Era of AI Models&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;This paper introduces prompted software engineering (PSE), which integrates prompt engineering to build effective prompts for language-based AI models, to enhance the software development process. PSE enables the use of AI models in software development to produce high-quality software with fewer resources, automating tedious tasks and allowing developers to focus on more innovative aspects. However, effective prompts are necessary to guide software development in generating accurate, relevant, and useful responses, while mitigating risks of misleading outputs. This paper describes how productive prompts should be built throughout the software development cycle.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Dae-Kyoo Kim&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;ArXiv&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompted-software-engineering-models-kim/8a730537b92c5edb99b34db118e6c181/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.48550/arXiv.2311.03359&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;abs/2311.03359&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:9},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;A Prompt Pattern Catalog to Enhance Prompt Engineering with ChatGPT&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;Prompt engineering is an increasingly important skill set needed to converse effectively with large language models (LLMs), such as ChatGPT. Prompts are instructions given to an LLM to enforce rules, automate processes, and ensure specific qualities (and quantities) of generated output. Prompts are also a form of programming that can customize the outputs and interactions with an LLM. This paper describes a catalog of prompt engineering techniques presented in pattern form that have been applied to solve common problems when conversing with LLMs. Prompt patterns are a knowledge transfer method analogous to software patterns since they provide reusable solutions to common problems faced in a particular context, i.e., output generation and interaction when working with LLMs. This paper provides the following contributions to research on prompt engineering that apply LLMs to automate software development tasks. First, it provides a framework for documenting patterns for structuring prompts to solve a range of problems so that they can be adapted to different domains. Second, it presents a catalog of patterns that have been applied successfully to improve the outputs of LLM conversations. Third, it explains how prompts can be built from multiple patterns and illustrates prompt patterns that benefit from combination with other prompt patterns.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Jules White&quot;,&quot;Quchen Fu&quot;,&quot;Sam Hays&quot;,&quot;M. Sandborn&quot;,&quot;Carlos Olea&quot;,&quot;Henry Gilbert&quot;,&quot;Ashraf Elnashar&quot;,&quot;Jesse Spencer-Smith&quot;,&quot;D. Schmidt&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;ArXiv&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompt-pattern-catalog-enhance-prompt-engineering-white/3df6fc9a2add5e67af6d57c99a4e32a6/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.48550/arXiv.2302.11382&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;abs/2302.11382&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:10},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Serving with engineering skills within 15 miles of campus: The Scholars of Excellence in Engineering and Computer Science program&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;The Scholars of Excellence in Engineering and Computer Science (SEECS) program initiated its first cohort of 20 students in fall 2009. Funded for two, five-year awards through a National Science Foundation (NSF) S-STEM grant, the interdisciplinary, multi-year, mixed academic-level program offers scholarships to students based on academic merit and financial need. The goals of the scholarship program are (1) to increase the number of academically talented, but financially disadvantaged students in the stated majors, (2) to assist students to be successful in their undergraduate education, and (3) to foster professional development for careers or graduate education. A hallmark principle behind these goals is to build a broad scope of engineering and professional skills which include interpersonal communication, client-focus, and community-service, knowing technical skills are readily developed in the students&#x27; academic courses. The SEECS program is delivered through the activities of a zero-credit seminar. The SEECS seminar encompasses three components: engineering design, professional development, and personal development. Through the engineering design component, the mechanism for realizing the hallmark principle is achieved. An engineering need of a non-profit community partner is identified, becoming the design project for the next two years for each new freshman class. The students become engaged in a longterm relationship with the non-profit community partner. The project provides a platform for exercising technical engineering skills and practices. The relationship, the organization, the contact people, the served audience provide a human culture with which the students become entwined. Consequently, the client-focus attitude of business is fostered in the engineering and computer science students. Unlike typical engineering semester-long projects -or even year-long capstone projects, the incremental pace over two years allows students to mature in their understanding of themselves, of the project, and of the community they serve. Through the two years, the students use more and various types of interpersonal communications than in a semester-long project. Further, the students do not view the client and his/her needs as a convenience for their education. The students become invested in the goals of the non-profit since the project&#x27;s understanding and conclusion become a shared focus between them. In the following paper, the techniques and steps used to identify projects, build relationships, and align the students with a community need are described. To illustrate these points, aspects of the SEECS program and its community projects are presented. Finally, an innovative model for a project-based, honors-option for academically-talented students in SEECS majors based upon the practices used in the SEECS program is proposed.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Theresa M. Vitolo&quot;,&quot;Barry J. Brinkman&quot;,&quot;Karinna M. Vernaza&quot;,&quot;Scott E. Steinbrink&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2016,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;2016 IEEE Frontiers in Education Conference (FIE)&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/serving-engineering-skills-within-miles-campus-scholars-vitolo/ba5a30b7d7fb539f83a536fb8402ba22/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.1109/FIE.2016.7757496&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;1-6&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:11},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Artificial intelligence prompt engineering as a new digital competence: Analysis of generative AI technologies such as ChatGPT&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;Objective: The article aims to offer a thorough examination and comprehension of the challenges and pro\u2010 spects connected with artificial intelligence (AI) prompt engineering. Our research aimed to create a theoret\u2010 ical framework that would highlight optimal approaches in the field of AI prompt engineering. Research Design &amp; Methods: This research utilized a narrative and critical literature review and established a conceptual framework derived from existing literature taking into account both academic and practitioner sources. This article should be regarded as a conceptual work that emphasizes the best practices in the domain of AI prompt engineering. Findings: Based on the conducted deep and extensive query of academic and practitioner literature on the subject, as well as professional press and Internet portals, we identified various insights for effective AI prompt engineering. We provide specific prompting strategies. Implications &amp; Recommendations: The study revealed the profound implications of AI prompt engineering across various domains such as entrepreneurship, art, science, and healthcare. We demonstrated how the effective crafting of prompts can significantly enhance the performance of large language models (LLMs), gen\u2010 erating more accurate and contextually relevant results. Our findings offer valuable insights for AI practition\u2010 ers, researchers, educators, and organizations integrating AI into their operations, emphasizing the need to invest time and resources in prompt engineering. Moreover, we contributed the AI PROMPT framework to the field, providing clear and actionable guidelines for text\u2010to\u2010text prompt engineering. Contribution &amp; Value Added: The value of this study lies in its comprehensive exploration of AI prompt engineer\u2010 ing as a digital competence. By building upon existing research and prior literature, this study aimed to provide a deeper understanding of the intricacies involved in AI prompt engineering and its role as a digital competence. Article&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;P. Korzy\u0144ski&quot;,&quot;G. Mazurek&quot;,&quot;Pamela Krzypkowska&quot;,&quot;Artur Kurasi\u0144ski&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;Entrepreneurial Business and Economics Review&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/intelligence-prompt-engineering-competence-analysis-korzy\u0144ski/fa73bf4614ed50dea4f90d01155b2666/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.15678/eber.2023.110302&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:12},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;PROMPT - Master Courses for Professional SoftwareDevelopers&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;PROMPT [1] is an educational initiative in cooperation with several academic parties and leading industrial companies and organizations. Together, the parties offer advanced level courses in software engineering in a web-based format, tailored to fit professional engineers and software developers who need to be able to combine full-time work and studies. The long-term goal of PROMPT is to guarantee the supply of advanced software competencies and innovativeness in industry. The courses are free of charge within Europe, cover typically 7.5 university credits and are run over a whole semester, at a pace of 25% of full-time. All courses are developed in close cooperation with the Swedish industry and trade organizations.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;S. Eck&quot;,&quot;Hans A. Hansson&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2019,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;ACM SIGSOFT Software Engineering Notes&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompt-master-courses-professional-softwaredevelopers-eck/9383dc0ef02e58278f541609992d21e6/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.1145/3310013.3322176&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;44&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;29 - 30&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:13},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;PROMPT - Master Courses for Professional SoftwareDevelopers&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;PROMPT [1] is an educational initiative in cooperation with several academic parties and leading industrial companies and organizations. Together, the parties offer advanced level courses in software engineering in a web-based format, tailored to fit professional engineers and software developers who need to be able to combine full-time work and studies. The long-term goal of PROMPT is to guarantee the supply of advanced software competencies and innovativeness in industry. The courses are free of charge within Europe, cover typically 7.5 university credits and are run over a whole semester, at a pace of 25% of full-time. All courses are developed in close cooperation with the Swedish industry and trade organizations.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;S. Eck&quot;,&quot;H. Hansson&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2019,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;ACM SIGSOFT Software Engineering Notes&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompt-master-courses-professional-softwaredevelopers-eck/038581943d805410832a7d8d3cb76d6e/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.1145/3310013.3310036&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;44&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;29 - 30&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:14},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Generative AI tools in art education: Exploring prompt engineering and iterative processes for enhanced creativity&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;The rapid development and adoption of generative artificial intelligence (AI) tools in the art and design education landscape have introduced both opportunities and challenges. This timely study addresses the need to effectively integrate these tools into the classroom while considering ethical implications and the importance of prompt engineering. By examining the iterative process of refining original ideas through multiple iterations, verbal expansion, and the use of OpenAI\u2019s DALL-E2 for generating diverse visual outcomes, researchers gain insights into the potential benefits and pitfalls of these tools in an educational context. Students in the digital at case study were taught prompt engineering techniques and were tasked with crafting multiple prompts, focusing on refining their ideas over time. Participants demonstrated an increased understanding of the potential and limitations of generative AI tools and how to manipulate subject matter for more effective results. The iterative process encouraged students to explore and experiment with their creative ideas, leading to a deeper understanding of the possibilities offered by AI tools. Despite acknowledging the ethical concerns regarding copyright and the potential replacement of artists, students appreciated the value of generative AI tools for enhancing their sketchbooks and ideation process. Through prompt engineering and iterative processes, students developed a more detail-oriented approach to their work. The challenge of using AI-generated images as final products was conceptually intriguing, requiring further investigation and consideration of the prompts. This study highlights the potential benefits and challenges of integrating generative AI tools into art and design classrooms, emphasizing the importance of prompt engineering, iterative processes, and ethical considerations as these technologies continue to evolve.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Peter Cotroneo&quot;,&quot;James Hutson&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2023,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;Metaverse&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/tools-education-exploring-prompt-engineering-processes-cotroneo/8bb145e6eab651bab627cbe0db1719a0/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.54517/m.v4i1.2164&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:15},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;PROMPT -- Master Courses for Professional Software Developers&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;PROMPT [1] is an educational initiative in cooperation with several academic parties and leading industrial companies and organizations. Together, the parties offer advanced level courses in software engineering in a web-based format, tailored to fit professional engineers and software developers who need to be able to combine full-time work and studies. The long-term goal of PROMPT is to guarantee the supply of advanced software competencies and innovativeness in industry. The courses are free of charge within Europe, cover typically 7.5 university credits and are run over a whole semester, at a pace of 25% of full-time. All courses are developed in close cooperation with the Swedish industry and trade organizations.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;S. Eck&quot;,&quot;Hans A. Hansson&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2019,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;ACM SIGSOFT Software Engineering Notes&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/prompt-master-courses-professional-software-developers-eck/d66f14fa107c51e3a170021ac320dca0/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.1145/3310013.3322182&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;44&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;35 - 35&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:16},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Grant-Writing Bootcamp: An Intervention to Enhance the Research Capacity of Academic Women in STEM&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;Abstract Broadening the participation of women in science, technology, engineering, and mathematical (STEM) fields is more than a social\u2010justice issue; diversity is paramount to a thriving national research agenda. However, women face several obstacles to fully actualizing their research potential. Enhancing the research capacity and opportunity of women faculty requires purposeful changes in university practice. Therefore, we designed an intervention, a grant\u2010writing bootcamp informed by self\u2010determination theory (Deci and Ryan 2012), to support the participants\u2019 feelings of relatedness, autonomy, and competence. Three grant\u2010writing bootcamps were run over an 18\u2010month period. Using a pre\u2010 and post\u2010test design over the span of 1 year (and contrasting results with a comparison sample who were not part of the intervention) showed that the women participating in the grant\u2010writing bootcamp significantly increased the number of external grants submitted, the number of proposals led as principal investigator, the number of external grants awarded, and the amount of external funding dollars awarded.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Jessi L. Smith&quot;,&quot;C. Stoop&quot;,&quot;Micaela Young&quot;,&quot;Rebecca Belou&quot;,&quot;Suzanne Held&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:2017,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;Bioscience&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/grantwriting-bootcamp-intervention-enhance-research-smith/25956e807f1652048a510eba2a2c763f/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.1093/biosci/bix050&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;67&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;638 - 645&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:17},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;A Venture Capital Fund for Undergraduate Engineering Students at Rowan University *&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;All engineering students at Rowan University are required to take the eight\u2010semester Engineering Clinic sequence wherein multidisciplinary student teams engage in semester\u2010long design projects. In addition to projects that are funded by local industry, faculty research grants or departmental budgets, a Venture Capital Fund has been created, which is specifically ear\u2010marked for the development of original student inventions. Funding of up to $2,500 per student team per semester is competitively awarded based on student\u2010generated proposals to the Venture Capital Fund, which has been created through a series of grants from the National Collegiate Inventors and Innovators Alliance (NCIIA). To qualify for funding, a multidisciplinary student team must propose, plan and implement an original, semester\u2010long product development enterprise. To date, 11 projects have been funded through the Venture Capital Fund. This paper describes the results of several student entrepreneurial projects and compares the results of student surveys to assess the effectiveness of entrepreneurial projects in satisfying the technical objectives of the Engineering Clinic. The results suggest that students engaged in entrepreneurial projects devote more hours per week on their projects, have more \u201cownership\u201d in their projects and have a better understanding of the technical aspects and societal impact of their projects than their counterparts who are engaged in the more traditional engineering design projects.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;A. Crafting effective prompts for AI models like OpenAI\u2019s GPT can optimize the quality of generated output, especially in reference services. "]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"request_id": "85fbfa071f3d4c4a-MXP", "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "666a0205-82bd-467e-ab34-b099c5c5c23c", "children": ["e76f6646-f1a1-4c82-b0bf-7e962320fc35"]}, "e76f6646-f1a1-4c82-b0bf-7e962320fc35": {"id": "e76f6646-f1a1-4c82-b0bf-7e962320fc35", "message": {"id": "e76f6646-f1a1-4c82-b0bf-7e962320fc35", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1709661336.295157, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Building a mailing list can be crucial for businesses and individuals looking to connect with their audience. However, it&#x27;s important to gather emails ethically and ensure compliance with privacy regulations like GDPR and CAN-SPAM. Here are some legitimate ways to build an email list:\n\n1. **Offer Incentives:**\n   - Provide valuable content like e-books, whitepapers, or exclusive access in exchange for email sign-ups.\n   - Run contests or giveaways and make email subscription a requirement for entry.\n\n2. **Content Upgrades:**\n   - Create additional resources related to your content (e.g., downloadable PDFs, checklists) and offer them in exchange for email subscriptions.\n\n3. **Webinars and Events:**\n   - Host webinars or online events and require attendees to sign up with their email addresses.\n\n4. **Social Media:**\n   - Promote your mailing list on social media platforms and encourage followers to subscribe.\n   - Run targeted ads to reach specific demographics interested in your content or products.\n\n5. **Opt-in Forms on Website:**\n   - Place opt-in forms strategically on your website, including pop-ups, sidebar forms, and within blog posts.\n\n6. **Exit-Intent Pop-ups:**\n   - Use exit-intent pop-ups to capture the attention of visitors who are about to leave your website without subscribing.\n\n7. **Landing Pages:**\n   - Create dedicated landing pages for specific offers or campaigns with a focus on encouraging email sign-ups.\n\n8. **Referral Programs:**\n   - Implement a referral system where current subscribers can earn incentives for referring others to join the mailing list.\n\n9. **Exclusive Updates:**\n   - Promote the exclusivity of your email list by offering subscribers early access, special promotions, or insider information.\n\n10. **Networking Events:**\n    - Collect emails at conferences, trade shows, or other networking events where your target audience is present.\n\n11. **Customer Checkout:**\n    - Include an opt-in checkbox during the online checkout process, but make sure it&#x27;s not pre-checked (compliance with privacy laws).\n\n12. **Cross-Promotions:**\n    - Collaborate with other businesses or influencers for cross-promotions, reaching new audiences and potentially gaining subscribers.\n\nRemember to always respect user privacy and clearly communicate how their information will be used. Additionally, comply with relevant data protection regulations to maintain trust with your audience."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true
, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [100260]}, "citations": [], "gizmo_id": null, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "text-davinci-002-render-sha", "parent_id": "aaa246ee-9927-43c4-8fdd-5876e4c3153f", "request_id": "85fbfa071f3d4c4a-MXP", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "aaa246ee-9927-43c4-8fdd-5876e4c3153f", "children": ["aaa28d54-62ab-4bbd-a3e2-8269cc0af999"]}, "aaa28d54-62ab-4bbd-a3e2-8269cc0af999": {"id": "aaa28d54-62ab-4bbd-a3e2-8269cc0af999", "message": {"id": "aaa28d54-62ab-4bbd-a3e2-8269cc0af999", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1709661401.029006, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["is there anywhere you can go to just find a list of emails online? Prepare yourself.&quot; si traduce come:\n\n&quot;Le prossime settimane saranno difficili, molto difficili. Preparati.&quot;\n\nEcco una spiegazione delle forme verbali e dei tempi utilizzati in questa traduzione:\n\n1. &quot;Saranno&quot; - Questa \u00e8 la forma del futuro semplice del verbo &quot;essere&quot; (to be) in italiano. \u00c8 usata per esprimere azioni o eventi futuri.\n\n2. &quot;Difficili, molto difficili&quot; - Questa parte della frase utilizza l&#x27;aggettivo &quot;difficili&quot; per esprimere la difficolt\u00e0 delle settimane future, e poi &quot;molto difficili&quot; per enfatizzare ulteriormente il grado di difficolt\u00e0.\n\n3. &quot;Preparati&quot; - Questa \u00e8 la forma imperativa del verbo &quot;prepararsi&quot; (to prepare oneself). L&#x27;imperativo viene utilizzato per dare un comando o un consiglio diretto a qualcuno. In questo caso, &quot;preparati&quot; \u00e8 rivolto a una seconda persona singolare (&quot;you&quot;), ed \u00e8 un invito a prepararsi per affrontare le settimane difficili che verranno.\n\nLa scelta di questi tempi verbali e forme grammaticali \u00e8 dettata dalla necessit\u00e0 di comunicare un evento futuro (le settimane difficili), enfatizzare la difficolt\u00e0 di queste settimane e dare un consiglio diretto alla persona a cui ci si sta rivolgendo."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

, "weight": 0.0, "metadata": {"rebase_system_message": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "text-davinci-002-render-sha", "parent_id": "041d9138-8bb6-4557-92d8-cb7e296560d7", "timestamp_": "absolute", "is_visually_hidden_from_conversation": true}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "041d9138-8bb6-4557-92d8-cb7e296560d7", "children": ["482d5d8c-e061-4f6d-9fad-7c8c003edf7e"]}, "482d5d8c-e061-4f6d-9fad-7c8c003edf7e": {"id": "482d5d8c-e061-4f6d-9fad-7c8c003edf7e", "message": {"id": "482d5d8c-e061-4f6d-9fad-7c8c003edf7e", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1698132986.003739, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["La differenza nella forma &quot;ti&quot; in frasi come &quot;ti massacro&quot; rispetto a frasi come &quot;aiutarti&quot; o &quot;abbracciarti&quot; \u00e8 dovuta all&#x27;uso dei pronomi oggetto e riflessivi nella lingua italiana.\n\n1. &quot;Ti massacro&quot;:\n   - In questa frase, &quot;ti&quot; \u00e8 un pronome oggetto diretto della seconda persona singolare. Viene utilizzato quando l&#x27;azione \u00e8 diretta verso il soggetto (tu). In questo caso, &quot;massacro&quot; implica un&#x27;azione aggressiva o minacciosa diretta verso &quot;tu,&quot; quindi il pronome oggetto diretto &quot;ti&quot; \u00e8 appropriato.\n\n2. &quot;Aiutarti&quot; e &quot;abbracciarti&quot;:\n   - In queste frasi, &quot;ti&quot; \u00e8 un pronome riflessivo della seconda persona singolare. I pronomi riflessivi vengono utilizzati quando l&#x27;azione del verbo riguarda il soggetto stesso o quando l&#x27;azione \u00e8 reciproca tra il soggetto e un altro. In &quot;aiutarti,&quot; il soggetto (tu) sta ricevendo aiuto da se stesso. In &quot;abbracciarti,&quot; il soggetto (tu) sta ricevendo un abbraccio da se stesso o da qualcun altro. I pronomi riflessivi sono comuni in situazioni in cui l&#x27;azione \u00e8 rivolta a se stessi o in relazioni reciproche tra le persone.\n\nQuindi, la differenza principale \u00e8 che &quot;ti&quot; \u00e8 un pronome oggetto diretto in frasi come &quot;ti massacro,&quot; mentre \u00e8 un pronome riflessivo in frasi come &quot;aiutarti&quot; o &quot;abbracciarti,&quot; a seconda se l&#x27;azione sia diretta verso il soggetto stesso o coinvolga un&#x27;azione reciproca."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

Here&#x27;s the explanation in English:\n\nThe difference in the use of &quot;ti&quot; in phrases like &quot;ti massacro&quot; compared to phrases like &quot;aiutarti&quot; or &quot;abbracciarti&quot; is due to the use of direct object and reflexive pronouns in the Italian language.\n\n1. &quot;Ti massacro&quot;:\n   - In this phrase, &quot;ti&quot; is a direct object pronoun for the second person singular. It is used when the action is directed towards the subject (you). In this case, &quot;massacro&quot; implies an aggressive or threatening action directed towards &quot;you,&quot; so the direct object pronoun &quot;ti&quot; is appropriate.\n\n2. &quot;Aiutarti&quot; and &quot;abbracciarti&quot;:\n   - In these phrases, &quot;ti&quot; is a reflexive pronoun for the second person singular. Reflexive pronouns are used when the action of the verb involves the subject itself or when the action is mutual between the subject and someone else. In &quot;aiutarti,&quot; the subject (you) is receiving help from yourself. In &quot;abbracciarti,&quot; the subject (you) is receiving a hug from yourself or someone else. Reflexive pronouns are common in situations where the action is directed towards oneself or in mutual relationships between people.\n\nSo, the main difference is that &quot;ti&quot; is a direct object pronoun in phrases like &quot;ti massacro,&quot; while it is a reflexive pronoun in phrases like &quot;aiutarti&quot; or &quot;abbracciarti,&quot; depending on whether the action is directed towards the subject itself or involves a mutual action."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

Let&#x27;s discuss the grammar and forms in the Italian phrases we&#x27;ve discussed using English.\n\n1. **Direct Object Pronouns vs. Reflexive Pronouns:**\n   - In Italian, direct object pronouns are used when the action of the verb is directed towards someone or something other than the subject. For example, &quot;ti massacro&quot; uses &quot;ti&quot; as a direct object pronoun because the action of &quot;massacro&quot; is directed towards &quot;you.&quot;\n\n   - Reflexive pronouns are used when the subject performs an action on themselves or when the action is mutual between the subject and someone else. For example, &quot;aiutarti&quot; and &quot;abbracciarti&quot; use &quot;ti&quot; as a reflexive pronoun because the action involves the subject (you) either helping themselves or receiving a hug.\n\n2. **Tenses and Forms:**\n   - The choice of tenses and forms in Italian depends on the context and the intended meaning.\n   - We discussed the use of the future tense &quot;saranno&quot; for future actions, such as &quot;Le prossime settimane saranno difficili&quot; (The following weeks will be difficult).\n\n   - We also looked at the imperative form, like &quot;Preparati,&quot; which is used for giving direct commands or advice, in this case, &quot;Prepare yourself.&quot;\n\n3. **Offering Help:**\n   - When offering help in Italian, you can use phrases like &quot;Posso aiutarti?&quot; (Can I help you?) or &quot;Posso darti una mano?&quot; (Can I give you a hand?). Here, &quot;aiutarti&quot; and &quot;darti&quot; are examples of direct object pronouns used in non-reflexive constructions.\n\nThese grammatical structures and forms are essential in Italian and play a crucial role in conveying meaning and intention in sentences."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

Suppongo che tu intendessi dire &quot;Chiedi, capisci mi?&quot; o qualcosa di simile. In tal caso, la frase corretta sarebbe &quot;Chiedi, capisci?&quot;.\n\nLa differenza tra &quot;Chiedi, capisci?&quot; e &quot;Hai capito?&quot; riguarda principalmente la struttura e l&#x27;uso. Entrambe le frasi cercano di ottenere conferma se qualcuno ha capito qualcosa, ma la prima \u00e8 una forma pi\u00f9 dettagliata e potrebbe essere utilizzata quando si vuole incoraggiare l&#x27;interlocutore a esprimere eventuali dubbi o domande specifiche. La seconda \u00e8 pi\u00f9 diretta e generica.\n\nEcco una breve spiegazione delle due frasi:\n\n1. **&quot;Chiedi, capisci?&quot;**\n   - Si usa quando si vuole invitare l&#x27;interlocutore a chiedere o esprimere eventuali punti poco chiari o dubbi.\n   - Potrebbe essere utilizzato quando si sta spiegando qualcosa e si vuole assicurarsi che l&#x27;altro comprenda completamente.\n\n2. **&quot;Hai capito?&quot;**\n   - \u00c8 una domanda diretta che chiede semplicemente se l&#x27;interlocutore ha capito ci\u00f2 che \u00e8 stato detto.\n   - \u00c8 pi\u00f9 generica e potrebbe essere usata dopo aver dato istruzioni o spiegato qualcosa.\n\nSpero che questa spiegazione sia chiara! Se hai ulteriori domande, sono qui per aiutarti."]}, "status": "finished_successfully","end_turn": true

Viene spesso utilizzata quando si vuole esprimere un desiderio o una richiesta di comprensione immediata da parte dell&#x27;interlocutore. Ad esempio, potresti usarla quando stai cercando di spiegare qualcosa in modo emotivo o urgente e vuoi assicurarti che la persona ti stia seguendo.\n\n2. **&quot;Hai capito?&quot;** \u00e8 una domanda pi\u00f9 generale e pu\u00f2 essere tradotta come &quot;Did you understand?&quot; in inglese. Viene utilizzata per chiedere se la persona ha compreso ci\u00f2 che \u00e8 stato detto o spiegato. Pu\u00f2 essere utilizzata in vari contesti, come in un discorso formale o informale.\n\nIn breve, &quot;Capiscimi?&quot; \u00e8 pi\u00f9 enfatica e emotiva, mentre &quot;Hai capito?&quot; \u00e8 una domanda pi\u00f9 generica sulla comprensione. Poi traduttori lo e con la stessa moda e stylo di me quando noi abbiamo parlato in italiano. Pero, devi farlo con gramatica correta, farmi tanti fluenta, lo sai? \n\nHarnessing the Power of Intention Transforming Emotions and Shaping Our\u00a0Reality\nNavigating Life&#x27;s Rollercoaster\nLife often resembles a thrilling rollercoaster ride, filled with unexpected twists and turns that can leave us feeling exhilarated one moment and overwhelmed the next. Picture those mornings when it seems like the universe is playing tricks on us\u200a-\u200arushing out the door, only to miss our train and find ourselves stranded on a crowded platform, frustrated and frazzled by the chaos of everyday life. In these moments, it&#x27;s natural to question whether we can truly choose happiness amidst the whirlwind of life&#x27;s challenges.\nBut here&#x27;s the thing about rollercoasters\u200a-\u200awhile we can&#x27;t control the twists and turns of the track, we can control how we respond to the ride. Similarly, in the rollercoaster of life, we may not always have control over our external circumstances, but we have complete control over how we navigate and perceive them. It&#x27;s within this realm of control that the power of intention comes into play, offering us a pathway to cultivate happiness and peace.\nLet&#x27;s delve into the intriguing world of intention and how it affects our emotions and reality. We will consider some practical strategies based on scientific research and modern philosophy that can help us cope with life&#x27;s inevitable highs and lows.\nThe Science of Intention: Rewiring Our Brain for Positivity\nIn the realm of neuroscience, pioneering researchers like Haggard have uncovered fascinating insights into the power of intention. Haggard&#x27;s groundbreaking work suggests that our brains begin preparing for action before we&#x27;re even consciously aware of it, indicating that our intentions have a direct impact on our neural pathways (Haggard, 2005).\nOne practical way to leverage this insight is by starting our day with a clear intention or goal in mind. Setting a positive intention can help prime our brain for success and focus our energy on what matters most to us.\nPhilosophical Musings: Intentions vs. Willpower\nVenturing into the realm of philosophy, scholars such as Adams and Mele engage in thought-provoking debates surrounding intention and willpower. They propose that our actions are influenced not only by sheer will but also by the intricate interplay between intention, effort, and feedback (Adams &amp; Mele, 1992).\nTo cultivate a mindset of resilience, we can reframe challenges as opportunities for growth. Embracing a &quot;growth mindset&quot; enables us to approach difficulties with optimism and determination, aligning our intentions with our actions.\nEmbracing Intentionality: Finding Peace in the\u00a0Chaos\nRenowned philosopher Rollo May sheds light on the concept of intentionality as the cornerstone of human will. May&#x27;s insights urge us to realign our deeper intentions to reshape our perception of reality, even in the face of adversity (May, 1965).\nTo practice intentionality in our daily lives, we can incorporate mindfulness techniques. Staying present and fully engaged in the moment allows us to cultivate inner peace and acceptance, regardless of external circumstances.\nThe Role of Willpower: Strengthening Our Mental Resilience\nFurther studies by Fitch and Ravlin underscore the vital role of willpower in shaping our actions and emotional responses. Their findings suggest that nurturing strong willpower allows us to maintain inner calm and resilience, even amidst life&#x27;s most challenging moments (Fitch &amp; Ravlin, 2005).\nTo build our willpower &quot;muscle,&quot; we can set small, achievable goals and gradually increase the level of challenge. Celebrating our successes along the way reinforces positive behaviors and strengthens our resolve.\nEmpowering Ourselves Through Intention\nThe interplay between intention, willpower, and emotional experiences offers a profound perspective on navigating life&#x27;s rollercoaster. While we may not always have control over the twists and turns of the track, the power of intention empowers us to take control of our emotional responses and shape our reality from within.\nJust as a skilled rollercoaster rider anticipates each turn and loop with confidence and composure, we can also cultivate happiness and peace by aligning our intentions with our actions. By living with intentionality and mindfulness, we create a life that is meaningful and fulfilling, regardless of the external circumstances we encounter along the way.\nFurther Exploration: Diving Deeper into Intention and Its\u00a0Impact\nFor those intrigued by the dynamics of intention, willpower, and emotion, delving into the realms of cognitive neuroscience, philosophy of mind, and psychology, a significant article to consider is &quot;Conscious intention and motor cognition&quot; by P. Haggard (2005), published in Trends in Cognitive Sciences. This article provides a comprehensive view that bridges the gap between abstract philosophical discussions and tangible neuroscientific findings, offering a rich platform for exploring the power of human intention and willpower in shaping our emotional and behavioral responses.\nAs we continue on our journey of exploration, let&#x27;s remain curious and open-minded, experimenting with different techniques and approaches to see what resonates most with us and fits best into our lifestyle."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"request_id": "85f65ceb4cff74e8-FCO", "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "aee58482-0237-4e12-9570-cb8af2b09fb3", "children": ["6aa40197-00de-4b2c-9a04-983c20a3af28"]}, "6aa40197-00de-4b2c-9a04-983c20a3af28": {"id": "6aa40197-00de-4b2c-9a04-983c20a3af28", "message": {"id": "6aa40197-00de-4b2c-9a04-983c20a3af28", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1709602473.70144, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Sfruttare il Potere dell&#x27;Intenzione: Trasformare le Emozioni e Modellare la Nostra Realt\u00e0\n\nNavigare sulle Montagne Russe della Vita\nLa vita spesso somiglia a un&#x27;entusiasmante corsa sulle montagne russe, piena di inaspettati tornanti e svolte che possono lasciarci estasiati un momento e sopraffatti il successivo. Immaginate quelle mattine in cui sembra che l&#x27;universo ci stia giocando brutti scherzi: uscire di corsa dalla porta solo per perdere il treno e trovarsi bloccati su un marciapiede affollato, frustrati e stressati dal caos della vita quotidiana. In questi momenti, \u00e8 naturale chiedersi se possiamo davvero scegliere la felicit\u00e0 in mezzo al turbine delle sfide della vita.\nMa ecco la cosa sulle montagne russe: mentre non possiamo controllare i tornanti e le svolte del percorso, possiamo controllare come reagiamo al viaggio. Allo stesso modo, nella montagna russa della vita, potremmo non sempre avere il controllo sulle nostre circostanze esterne, ma abbiamo il completo controllo su come le navighiamo e le percepiamo. \u00c8 proprio in questo ambito di controllo che il potere dell&#x27;intenzione entra in gioco, offrendoci un percorso per coltivare felicit\u00e0 e pace.\nApprofondiamo il mondo intrigante dell&#x27;intenzione e come essa influisce sulle nostre emozioni e sulla realt\u00e0. Esamineremo alcune strategie pratiche basate sulla ricerca scientifica e sulla filosofia moderna che possono aiutarci a far fronte agli alti e bassi inevitabili della vita.\nLa Scienza dell&#x27;Intenzione: Riscrivere il Nostro Cervello per la Positivit\u00e0\nNell&#x27;ambito delle neuroscienze, ricercatori pionieristici come Haggard hanno scoperto insight affascinanti sul potere dell&#x27;intenzione. Il lavoro innovativo di Haggard suggerisce che i nostri cervelli iniziano a prepararsi per l&#x27;azione prima che ne siamo consapevoli, indicando che le nostre intenzioni hanno un impatto diretto sulle nostre vie neurali (Haggard, 2005).\nUn modo pratico per sfruttare questo insight \u00e8 iniziare la nostra giornata con un&#x27;intenzione o un obiettivo chiaro in mente. Stabilire un&#x27;intenzione positiva pu\u00f2 aiutare a predisporre il nostro cervello per il successo e concentrare la nostra energia su ci\u00f2 che per noi conta di pi\u00f9.\nRiflessioni Filosofiche: Intenzioni vs. Forza di Volont\u00e0\nAddentrandoci nel campo della filosofia, studiosi come Adams e Mele si impegnano in dibattiti stimolanti su intenzione e forza di volont\u00e0. Essi propongono che le nostre azioni siano influenzate non solo dalla pura volont\u00e0, ma anche dall&#x27;interazione intricata tra intenzione, sforzo e feedback (Adams &amp; Mele, 1992).\nPer coltivare una mentalit\u00e0 di resilienza, possiamo riformulare le sfide come opportunit\u00e0 di crescita. Abbracciando una &quot;mentalit\u00e0 di crescita&quot;, possiamo affrontare le difficolt\u00e0 con ottimismo e determinazione, allineando le nostre intenzioni con le nostre azioni.\nAbbracciare l&#x27;Intenzionalit\u00e0: Trovare Pace nel Caos\nIl rinomato filosofo Rollo May fa luce sul concetto di intenzionalit\u00e0 come pietra angolare della volont\u00e0 umana. Le intuizioni di May ci spingono a riallineare le nostre intenzioni pi\u00f9 profonde per plasmare la nostra percezione della realt\u00e0, anche di fronte all&#x27;avversit\u00e0 (May, 1965).\nPer praticare l&#x27;intenzionalit\u00e0 nella nostra vita quotidiana, possiamo incorporare tecniche di mindfulness. Rimanere presenti e completamente impegnati nel momento ci consente di coltivare pace interiore e accettazione, indipendentemente dalle circostanze esterne.\nIl Ruolo della Forza di Volont\u00e0: Rafforzare la Nostra Resilienza Mentale\nUlteriori studi condotti da Fitch e Ravlin sottolineano il ruolo vitale della forza di volont\u00e0 nel plasmare le nostre azioni e le nostre risposte emotive. Haggard (2005), pubblicato su Trends in Cognitive Sciences. Picture those mornings when it seems like the universe is playing tricks on us \u2014 rushing out the door, only to miss our train and find ourselves stranded on a crowded platform, frustrated and frazzled by the chaos of everyday life. In these moments, it\u2019s natural to question whether we can truly choose happiness amidst the whirlwind of life\u2019s challenges.\n\nBut here\u2019s the thing about rollercoasters \u2014 while we can\u2019t control the twists and turns of the track, we can control how we respond to the ride. Similarly, in the rollercoaster of life, we may not always have control over our external circumstances, but we have complete control over how we navigate and perceive them. It\u2019s within this realm of control that the power of intention comes into play, offering us a pathway to cultivate happiness and peace.\n\nLet&#x27;s delve into the intriguing world of intention and how it affects our emotions and reality. We will consider some practical strategies based on scientific research and modern philosophy that can help us cope with life&#x27;s inevitable highs and lows.\n\nThe Science of Intention: Rewiring Our Brain for Positivity\nIn the realm of neuroscience, pioneering researchers like Haggard have uncovered fascinating insights into the power of intention. Haggard\u2019s groundbreaking work suggests that our brains begin preparing for action before we\u2019re even consciously aware of it, indicating that our intentions have a direct impact on our neural pathways (Haggard, 2005).\n\nOne practical way to leverage this insight is by starting our day with a clear intention or goal in mind. Setting a positive intention can help prime our brain for success and focus our energy on what matters most to us.\n\nPhilosophical Musings: Intentions vs. Willpower\nVenturing into the realm of philosophy, scholars such as Adams and Mele engage in thought-provoking debates surrounding intention and willpower. They propose that our actions are influenced not only by sheer will but also by the intricate interplay between intention, effort, and feedback (Adams &amp; Mele, 1992).\n\nTo cultivate a mindset of resilience, we can reframe challenges as opportunities for growth. Embracing a \u201cgrowth mindset\u201d enables us to approach difficulties with optimism and determination, aligning our intentions with our actions.\n\nEmbracing Intentionality: Finding Peace in the Chaos\nRenowned philosopher Rollo May sheds light on the concept of intentionality as the cornerstone of human will. May\u2019s insights urge us to realign our deeper intentions to reshape our perception of reality, even in the face of adversity (May, 1965).\n\nTo practice intentionality in our daily lives, we can incorporate mindfulness techniques. Staying present and fully engaged in the moment allows us to cultivate inner peace and acceptance, regardless of external circumstances.\n\nThe Role of Willpower: Strengthening Our Mental Resilience\nFurther studies by Fitch and Ravlin underscore the vital role of willpower in shaping our actions and emotional responses. Their findings suggest that nurturing strong willpower allows us to maintain inner calm and resilience, even amidst life\u2019s most challenging moments (Fitch &amp; Ravlin, 2005).\n\nTo build our willpower \u201cmuscle,\u201d we can set small, achievable goals and gradually increase the level of challenge. Celebrating our successes along the way reinforces positive behaviors and strengthens our resolve.\n\nEmpowering Ourselves Through Intention\nThe interplay between intention, willpower, and emotional experiences offers a profound perspective on navigating life\u2019s rollercoaster. While we may not always have control over the twists and turns of the track, the power of intention empowers us to take control of our emotional responses and shape our reality from within.\n\nJust as a skilled rollercoaster rider anticipates each turn and loop with confidence and composure, we can also cultivate happiness and peace by aligning our intentions with our actions. By living with intentionality and mindfulness, we create a life that is meaningful and fulfilling, regardless of the external circumstances we encounter along the way.\n\nFurther Exploration: Diving Deeper into Intention and Its Impact\nFor those intrigued by the dynamics of intention, willpower, and emotion, delving into the realms of cognitive neuroscience, philosophy of mind, and psychology, a significant article to consider is \u201cConscious intention and motor cognition\u201d by P. Haggard (2005), published in Trends in Cognitive Sciences. "text", "parts": ["{&quot;items&quot;:[{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Power and Intention&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;The paper argues that while the state of mind of an agent exercising power is relevant in analyzing the concept of power, much of the discussion about whether an intention must be complied with for there to be an exercise of power misconceives the issue at stake because it overrates the extent to which human behavior is ratiocinative. The argument is developed in the course of a discussion of several hypothetical examples. One conclusion is that for a person to exercise power it is normally necessary that he should have a favorable attitude to the effects in question, the word \u201cfavorable\u201d being used because it is highly general and hence relatively non-restrictive. The final conclusion is that the very generality of this criterion makes a precise conceptual analysis of power impossible.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;D. M. Do they also will to do things? More precisely, if people will to do things and their willing bears upon what they do, is willing, or volition, something distinct from intending and trying? This question is central to the intention/volition debate, a debate about the ingredients of the best theory of the nature and explanation of human action. A variety of competing conceptions of volition, intention, and trying have been advanced in the literature; it would be impossible to examine each thoroughly in a single paper. We can show, however, that the major functional roles ascribed to volition are nicely filled by a triad composed of intention, trying, and information feedback. Adams&quot;,&quot;A. Mele&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:1992,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;Canadian Journal of Philosophy&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/intentionvolition-debate1-adams/5bd4a67f0a4a56afb45781648f62a7f9/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;10.1080/00455091.1992.10717283&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;22&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;323 - 337&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:5},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Intentionality, the Heart of Human Will&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;THE concept of intentionality was central in the philosophy and psychology of the Middle Ages, but was perforce thrown out by Descartes&#x27; dichotomy between body and mind. For intentionality is the bridge that makes just such a bifurcation impossible. The concept was then reintroduced by Franz Brentano in the last half of the nineteenth century, whose forceful lectures at the University of Vienna both Freud and Husserl attended. Intentionality is present in all psychotherapy, and is shown in significant ways in Freud. But the concept has been almost entirely left out of our academic psychology, much to the impoverishment, I believe, of our understanding not only of human experience in the area of wish and will but of consciousness as well. Intentionality is at the heart of consciousness. I believe it is likewise the key to the problem of wish and will. Some readers might immediately identify intentionality with mere voluntarism and purposivism, and conclude prematurely that what I am discussing is only the obvious fact that we look at things with different goals in mind. But something considerably more significant than that is going on. To take an illustration from therapy: a patient&#x27;s voluntary intention, so far as he is consciously aware of it, is to get to his hour on time, to tell me this or that important thing that has happened to him, to relax and free associate. But his intentionality, in contrast, may well be to please me by playing the role of the \\&quot;good patient,\\&quot; or to impress me with how brilliant his free associations are, or to force my unconditioned attention by describing what catastrophic things he may do to himself or others. Intention is a conscious, psychological state; I can set myself voluntarily to do this or that. Intentionality, rather, refers to a state of being, and involves to a greater or lesser degree the totality of the person&#x27;s orientation to the world at that time. This may be opposite to conscious intention. Nunley&quot;],&quot;paper_publish_year&quot;:1998,&quot;publication_journal_name&quot;:&quot;Subtle Energies &amp; Energy Medicine Journal Archives&quot;,&quot;consensus_paper_details_url&quot;:&quot;https://consensus.app/papers/intention-authenticity-essence-challenge-evocation-nunley/b42bafd5bdd551d4ad8497d8e72e894e/?utm_source=chatgpt&quot;,&quot;doi&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;volume&quot;:&quot;9&quot;,&quot;pages&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;search_result_number&quot;:9},{&quot;paper_title&quot;:&quot;Towards computational models of intention detection and intention prediction&quot;,&quot;abstract&quot;:&quot;Intention recognition is one of the core components of mindreading, an important process in social cognition. Human beings, from age of 18months, have been shown to be able to extrapolate intentions from observed actions, even when the performer failed at achieving the goal. Existing accounts of intention recognition emphasize the use of an intent (plan) library, which is matched against observed actions for recognition. These therefore cannot account for recognition of failed sequences of actions, nor novel actions. In this paper, we begin to tackle these open questions by examining computational models for components of human intention recognition, which emphasize the ability of humans to detect and identify intentions in a sequence of observed actions, based solely on the rationality of movement (its efficiency). We provide a high-level overview of intention recognition as a whole, and then elaborate on two components of the model, which we believe to be at its core, namely, those of intention detection and intention prediction. By intention detection we mean the ability to discern whether a sequence of actions has any underlying intention at all, or whether it was performed in an arbitrary manner with no goal in mind. By intention prediction we mean the ability to extend an incomplete sequence of actions to its most likely intended goal. We evaluate the model, and these two components, in context of existing literature, and in a number of experiments with more than 140 human subjects. For intention detection, our model was able to attribute high levels of intention to those traces perceived by humans as intentional, and vice versa. For intention prediction as well, our model performed in a way that closely matched that of humans. The work highlights the intimate relationship between the ability to generate plans, and the ability to recognize intentions.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Elisheva Bonchek-Dokow&quot;,&quot;G. Scholars have largely treated power as an interpersonal construct involving control over other individuals, whereas choice has largely been treated as an intrapersonal construct that concerns the ability to select a preferred course of action. Although these constructs have historically been studied separately, we propose that they share a common foundation\u2014that both are rooted in an individual\u2019s sense of personal control. Because of this common underlying basis, we hypothesized that power and choice are substitutable; that is, we predicted that the absence of one would increase the desire for the other, which, when acquired, would serve to satisfy the broader need for control. We also predicted that choice and power would exhibit a threshold effect, such that once one source of control had been provided (e.g., power), the addition of the other (e.g., choice) would yield diminishing returns. However, it has remained unclear whether this prefrontal activity encodes a subject&#x27;s current intention. Instead, increased levels of activity could reflect preparation of motor responses, holding in mind a set of potential choices, tracking the memory of previous responses, or general processes related to establishing a new task set. Here we study subjects who freely decided which of two tasks to perform and covertly held onto an intention during a variable delay. Only after this delay did they perform the chosen task and indicate which task they had prepared. We demonstrate that during the delay, it is possible to decode from activity in medial and lateral regions of prefrontal cortex which of two tasks the subjects were covertly intending to perform. This suggests that covert goals can be represented by distributed patterns of activity in the prefrontal cortex, thereby providing a potential neural substrate for prospective memory. During task execution, most information could be decoded from a more posterior region of prefrontal cortex, suggesting that different brain regions encode goals during task preparation and task execution. Decoding of intentions was most robust from the medial prefrontal cortex, which is consistent with a specific role of this region when subjects reflect on their own mental states.&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;J. It requires smooth communication between the human and the robot. Human behavior is an expressive media of communication. This paper proposes a new function of \\&quot;active under standing of human intentions\\&quot; by a robot through monitoring of human behavior. The unique feature of the proposed function lies in the fact that it utilizes multi-communication channels in parallel. i.e., human intentions are understood not only through conscious behavior but also through unconscious behavior. The paper also proposes a robot architecture to realize the function. The following points are the key features of the architecture: a robot possesses multi-sensors which surround the human; and information processing is carried out by dual loops-a loop for information exchange between the human and the robot and a loop for human intention understanding. As an example of a robot with human intention understanding functions, the authors constructed a micro-teleoperation robot. It can automatically understand an operator&#x27;s intention through such unconscious behavior of touching a desk with an operator&#x27;s hand. The understood result is utilized to change the control mode of a master-slave manipulation system from fine motion to rough motion and vice versa. The experimental results prove that the proposed function is effective in making the operation of the system easier. Consequently the system is friendly to the operator.&lt;&lt;ETX&gt;&gt;&quot;,&quot;paper_authors&quot;:[&quot;Tomomasa Sato&quot;,&quot;Y. Nishida&quot;,&quot;J. Ichikawa&quot;,&quot;Y.
